description: These type definitions can be used with data resources - both in request and response.

Site.description: Location or a pinpoint on Earth.

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate in degrees that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface. Positive latitudes are north of the equator (0), and negative ones are south.

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate in degrees that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface. Positive longitudes are east of the prime meridian (0), and negative ones are west.

elevation.description: Elevation of the site on Earth above (or below) mean sea level in meters.

name.description: Any name of the site e.g., postal address.

countryISOCode.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two-letter country codes, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2.

mapUrl.description: Map URL where the location can be explored e.g., Google Maps or Solargis Prospect.

id.description: Solargis internal or any custom id. Id of site stored in a database.

examples.name: Pippu 比布町, Kamikawa District, Hokkaido, Japan
examples.description: Geog. coordinates should have at least 6 decimal places.

Portfolio.description: Data resource can represent a group of sites (or projects) - a portfolio or a fleet.

id.description: Solargis internal. Id of portfolio stored in a database.

Horizon.description: An outline (modeled as a set of points) of land and other objects defined against the sky - a skyline.

azimuth.description: Geographical azimuth of the point in degrees. From the 0 degree (North) advancing clockwise.

height.description: Angular height of the point in degrees. From the 0 degree up to 90 degrees.

uri.description: Solargis internal. If Horizon is a big object, using some URI (for getting the Horizon) can be more suitable.

Flag.description: Flags interpret data values. The flag value is an integer code together with its meaning.

validData.description: Data value marked by this flag is considered valid (included) or invalid (should be excluded).

Instrument.description: Measuring instrument or sensor of any type.

Event.description: Service or other event on measuring station or an instrument.

timeIsExact.description: Timestamp can represent exact or approximate instance of time

affectedColumns.description: If the array is empty, the event affects all columns.

vegetationState.description: Special information related to albedo and certain instruments.

conditionUponArrival.description: Before any service intervention, what was the original state of the instrument.

Author.description: Resource author (or provider). Something like a visit card.

solargisCompanyId.description: Solargis internal. Some authors can be our customers having the ID in database.

serviceDeskUrl.description: Web address of the author's service desk.

License.description: Licenses, attribution, copyright, constraints, NDAs related to the resource.

ChangeLog.description: Single log entry of the resource history.

description.description: Who did what and why with the resource.

SoftwareComponent.description: Details about any application or library which created or affected the resource. Do not use for data sources (see the DataSource).

name.$comment: Here the enum of all Solargis apps and libs could help.

details.description: Any details specific to processing step.
stochastically generated 1 minute records from 15 minute original records
TMY created from synthesized monthly data - recombination of data from different months (or parts) increases the chance of finding the desired TMY scenario.

DataSource.description: Origin of the resource. Usually an external data source, but can be also another resource or just anything.

examples.name: CFSv2 and GFS ((c) 2022 NOAA), ERA5 ((c) 2022 ECMWF)

TimeRange.description: Schema for a time period. Both edges are inclusive

evaluation.description: Concept used in the Solargis Analyst - under development.

consistencySet.description: Used in Solargis Analyst QC procedures.

QualityStatus.description: Used in Solargis Analyst. Typically, the whole resource is at a certain level of the QC process.

timestamp.description: When the QC status was recorded.

TimeShift.description: Used in Solargis Analyst. When the time reference check QC procedure is done (modification of the DATETIME column values), the applied time shifts are recorded for later reference. It's part of resource history.

EnergySystemConfiguration.description: Object describing inputs needed for the energy simulation. To be defined later.

id.description: Solargis internal reference of the energy system.
